reviews.text:
I have never been to this "Big Nick's Pizza " restaurant before.
This place is located at the
San Pedro.
When I arrived at the parking lot, I didn't have any problem finding a parking space.
The restaurant was very clean and well-organized & nicely maintained.
They had various selections
on the menu. I ordered the cheese pizza to go. I didn't
like to add lots of things to my pizza.
After I ordered my pizza,
I had to go to the Harbor Animal Clinic for my dog's
vaccinations.
The Nick's Pizza restaurant was very close to the Harbor Animal Clinic.
It only took half an hour to
get my dog vaccinated.
Anyway, after that I went back to the restaurant to pick up my pizza.
Then, I came home and I tried Nick's famous cheese pizza.
The pizza was cheesy & tasty. It was delicious pizza!
I loved the mozzarella cheese!  It was my favorite
cheese. It was so creamy
and cheesy pizza. I love it!
I also liked their great services. All the employees were friendly, helpful & are attentive.
I would like to recommend
this "Big Nick's Pizza " restaurant to everyone.
They have delicious & tasty pizza!üòã

I am very glad I stumbled upon Big Nick‚Äôs Pizza.
I really like the decoration and how everything is well put together. The service was friendly, attentive, and fast.
The food was delicious. The pizza was great with flavorful pizza sauce. You can tell they use quality ingredients and the pizza dough was cooked to perfection with a semi crunchy crust and a soft dough in the inside. I also ordered the sample platter which included zucchinis, jalape√±o poppers, chicken, wings, and mozzarella sticks. Everything was delicious. My only recommendation would be to cook the chicken wings, a tad bit longer. Another appetizer we got was a fried calamari one of the best I‚Äôve had.
My girlfriend ordered the lasagna and I have to admit it was good but definitely had better however I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs bad so with that being said, I would leave that to your discretion and give it a try.
Other than that, I would say parking is quite difficult if you go during dinner time which is when I went, you will have a hard time finding parking.

Big Nick‚Äôs is one of those neighborhood pizza joints that feels like home the second you walk in. The staff are warm and always greet you with a smile, even on busy nights. Their New York‚Äìstyle slices are huge and cheesy, with just the right amount of grease. I love that they also serve Greek dishes, so you can get a gyro with your pizza. It‚Äôs casual, affordable, and perfect after a day by the harbor

I didn‚Äôt get to meet or verify there actually is a big Nick but his restaurant was great! The people there were very friendly starting with the young lady up front and the rest of the crew that served us! The food was really good! I had the calamari appetizer and their create your own pizza and was highly satisfied! My son had the pesto chicken and loved it! My mother in-law had the lobster ravioli and said it was delicious. Sadly we are from out of town so the chances we get to go back there are slim by being from NY originally and knowing my Italian food I highly recommend them!

It‚Äôs in the corner of the strip mall. The ambiance is fair enough. We have ordered the wings , bbq pizza , veggie pizza and pasta. Did not like the pasta much and the bbq pizza bit sweeter bcz of sauce and the base is harder . Veggies tastes good .

editorial_summary.overview: Unfussy parlor selling hand-tossed pies, pastas & subs plus delivery until late.

recentReviews.text: We ordered a large Nick's Special pizza and it was delicious. The flavor reminded me of the kind of pizza you'd eat as a kid, with original fresh ingredients. Loved it. The atmosphere was great too, the space was very clean, plenty of room when you sit down, even for a small place. The options are great if you don't want pizza too, pasta and salad dishes. They play sports on the tv's and you can order a few alcoholic beverages on the menu as well. Parking is sorta limited, so when it gets busy, i can imagine parking can be a problem. Overall, loved it and will definitely be back.

Won a gift certificate for Big Nick's from a church service up at Pt.Fermin Park. So very thankful for the opportunity to enjoy this restaurant. I definitely will be back the next I'm craving pizza. This place is Awesome !!!!!
Absolutely love the food from Big Nicks .  And always a quick delivery.

My husband and I were in town and he knows I LOVE pizza & hot wings so when he had tried this place a couple weeks before the next trip we took out here he took me and it was amazing!!  The atmosphere is chill and the pizza and wings are some of the best I‚Äôve had!!  Thank you for making our trip that much better and for the amazing food if you‚Äôre looking for great pizza and wings in a good atmosphere this is the place to go!!

Eggplant was good, fried zuchini‚Äôs were ok.

Spaghetti was watery, sauce not seasoned, garlic bread dry. They don‚Äôt have/serve Angel hair pasta (why not?).

Big Nick‚Äôs is one of those neighborhood pizza joints that feels like home the second you walk in. The staff are warm and always greet you with a smile, even on busy nights. Their New York‚Äìstyle slices are huge and cheesy, with just the right amount of grease. I love that they also serve Greek dishes, so you can get a gyro with your pizza. It‚Äôs casual, affordable, and perfect after a day by the harbor

detailedReviews.author: JellyB A.
detailedReviews.text: We ordered a large Nick's Special pizza and it was delicious. The flavor reminded me of the kind of pizza you'd eat as a kid, with original fresh ingredients. Loved it. The atmosphere was great too, the space was very clean, plenty of room when you sit down, even for a small place. The options are great if you don't want pizza too, pasta and salad dishes. They play sports on the tv's and you can order a few alcoholic beverages on the menu as well. Parking is sorta limited, so when it gets busy, i can imagine parking can be a problem. Overall, loved it and will definitely be back.

Thank you for making our trip that much better and for the amazing food if you‚Äôre looking for great pizza and wings in a good atmosphere this is the place to go!!

detailedReviews.text: FORGET ABOUT IT!!! It's not worth your time. The pizza is soft and bread-like without a lot of toppings. The Alfredo sauce is thin and lacks flavor. Overall, it was a major disappointment. And all the positive reviews show that people are really nuts and don't know what good food tastes like!

detailedReviews.author: Edna Zuberia
detailedReviews.text: I live in West Covina and drive to this location because I normally enjoy the food and the server is ALWAYS amazing. But this last few times we have gone it has not been the same. The server who use to work there Corina was amazing but the new ones they have do not compare. It might be time to find a new location to host get togethers.

detailedReviews.author: Karan Vashisht
detailedReviews.text:
What do you do when you have a family gathering?
Order Big Nick's.
What do you do when it's dinner time and no one feels like cooking?
Order Big Nick's.
What do you do when you are watching a ball game?
Order Big Nick's.
Big Nick's there when you need them and even when you don't.
Good pizza, terrible parking, lot, excellent service!

detailedReviews.author: Joe's Jeans
detailedReviews.text: I recently found this place and I realized that I've been missing out for a long time while living in Southbay. I was always 'whatever' about typical COMBO pizza, but theirs is special and it is my top choice here. I haven't dined in yet, but the interior is pretty cool. It has very Italian vibe and I love it. It shows that they've been around for quite some time.

detailedReviews.author: Aurelio Isidro
detailedReviews.text: I was in the area on a Sunday night around 9 PM, saw the 4.5 stars and decided to give it a shot. I chose the BBQ chicken pizza based on reviews and it was so good! I'm having the leftovers for breakfast as I type this. Did I mention it's so good !

detailedReviews.author: Sandie Harris
detailedReviews.text: I moved to Ca 2yrs ago from NYC and I‚Äôve missed NYC  food esp Pizza.  I‚Äôve tried so many pizza‚Äôs and did not like any. Either it was the sauce or the dough but I just couldn‚Äôt do it UNTIL today. Someone told my BF about Nicks. I stopped getting excited or hopeful that I would have a good ole NYC slice. We went to Nicks and I didn‚Äôt even bother to order. I told my BF I‚Äôd have one of his 12 slices. Well I‚Äôm so happy to say Nicks has pleasantly surprised me. The sauce is on point and the dough is PERFECT. I had 3 slices and I enjoyed every bite. I‚Äôm so happy. Now when I‚Äôm craving pizza,, it‚Äôs Nicks time. If I was in a pizzeria in NYC and was served a slice of Nicks I wouldnt think 2x about it.

detailedReviews.text:
I am very glad I stumbled upon Big Nick‚Äôs Pizza.
I really like the decoration and how everything is well put together. The service was friendly, attentive, and fast.
The food was delicious. The pizza was great with flavorful pizza sauce. You can tell they use quality ingredients and the pizza dough was cooked to perfection with a semi crunchy crust and a soft dough in the inside. I also ordered the sample platter which included zucchinis, jalape√±o poppers, chicken, wings, and mozzarella sticks. Everything was delicious. My only recommendation would be to cook the chicken wings, a tad bit longer. Another appetizer we got was a fried calamari one of the best I‚Äôve had.
My girlfriend ordered the lasagna and I have to admit it was good but definitely had better however I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs bad so with that being said, I would leave that to your discretion and give it a try.
Other than that, I would say parking is quite difficult if you go during dinner time which is when I went, you will have a hard time finding parking.

detailedReviews.author: Elena Speers
detailedReviews.text: $30 for a salad and 2 slices of pizza!?! You order at the counter and they drop the food off,  in all plastic btw,  and never check on you or even look in your direction... yet I felt obligated to tip in advance, not realizing the lack of service. This place is great for the longshore workforce on their lunch break but that's about it.

detailedReviews.author: Danae Cervantes
detailedReviews.text: Great little hidden treasure this place is! The bar & the dining area have a cool little vibe! The bathroom situation was very confusing to me, so I just ended up just not going! Lol. But the flood was great! The service was great!! & The atmosphere was great!

detailedReviews.author: John Aguatis
detailedReviews.text: opted for commercial cleaning services, and the team did an exceptional job they cleaned everything meticulously and ensured that our workplace was looking professional and welcoming

detailedReviews.author: Chris Ziarek-Rowley
detailedReviews.text:
Wish I could taste this higher after hearing how great it was from friends.  I ordered at 553 on my way driving there. Just 1 pizza and was told it would be about 25 minutes.  After watching at least 3 people walk in and order to go receive their food before me I asked them about it.  The woman went to check and grabbed a pizza that was just sitting there and mumbled something about being busy.  Pizza had just been sitting there cold. I asked if it was just sitting there and she said it was just brought out- which it hadn't as I had been standing there watching. The time now was 643.

Cold pizza.  Terrible service.  Refused to remake it.  I'm inclined to say this was blatant RACISM and DISCRIMINATION given my skin color and that of the people who ordered 10-15mins after me yet all received their orders long before me.

detailedReviews.author: ramya G
detailedReviews.text: It‚Äôs in the corner of the strip mall. The ambiance is fair enough. We have ordered the wings , bbq pizza , veggie pizza and pasta. Did not like the pasta much and the bbq pizza bit sweeter bcz of sauce and the base is harder . Veggies tastes good .

detailedReviews.text: The Margarita pizza is one of the best pizzas I've ever had, and their ranch is extra special. It's a little bit spicy so delicious!

Big Nick's Pizza was pretty good. Friendly customer service. Delicious flavorful pizza and cheesy. Yum. The restaurant has a home style feel, too. I got wings and a custom pizza. I was excited and I forgot to take a picture. üòÖ
The key lime pie let me down. Maybe you get a real slice if you dine in? Idk.

But overall pretty darn tasty.
The leftovers smack too. üòã

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.5/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the delicious, cheesy, and flavorful pizza that reminds them of childhood favorites. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The warm and friendly staff consistently provide excellent customer service, making guests feel at home. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The restaurant offers a variety of menu options beyond pizza, including Greek dishes and pasta, catering to diverse tastes. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues, such as complaints about food quality and service - review management can address this concern
Long wait times and service inefficiencies, leading to customer dissatisfaction - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Lack of atmosphere/ambiance awareness and competition with other locations - social media marketing can improve this area
